meanings.definition: To increase the size or resolution of something, especially a digital image or video.
meanings.sent1: I upscaled the picture to make it bigger and clearer.
meanings.sent2: She always upscaled the resolution of her photos before posting them online.
meanings.sent3: The cat accidentally upscaled the image on the screen by walking on the keyboard.
meanings.sent4: His dreams upscaled to high-definition, showing him vivid scenes of adventure.
meanings.sent5: The artist upscaled the painting, bringing out every tiny detail beautifully.

meanings.definition: To improve the quality or value of something, typically by making it more luxurious or sophisticated.
meanings.sent1: They upscaled the hotel by adding elegant decorations and modern amenities.
meanings.sent2: The company upscaled their products to attract a more upscale clientele.
meanings.sent3: The joke about the fancy hat being upscaled with a feather made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her voice upscaled the atmosphere of the room, making it feel more refined.
meanings.sent5: The new packaging design upscaled the brand, giving it a premium look.
